    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public static int insert(java.lang.String userQuery)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs one of the INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE SQL queries. Ideally, this should be called when we make an INSERT SQL query. Closes the Statement object after it is complete.
        Parameters:
        userQuery - the SQL statement to be executed
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when the query fails
        Pre:
        userQuery.length > 0

      • insert

        public static int insert(java.lang.String userQuery,
         int autoKey)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Overloaded insert method. Returns the newly auto-incremented key, instead of the number of rows affected by the query.
        Parameters:
        userQuery -
        autoKey -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • update

        public static int update(java.lang.String userQuery)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Alias of the create() method. Ideally, this is called whenever we make an UPDATE SQL query.
        Parameters:
        userQuery - the SQL statement to be executed
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when the query fails
        Pre:
        userQuery.length > 0

      • delete

        public static int delete(java.lang.String userQuery)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Alias of the create() method. Ideally, this is called whenever we make a DELETE SQL query.
        Parameters:
        userQuery - the SQL statement to be executed
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when the query fails
        Pre:
        userQuery.length > 0

      • select

        public static java.sql.ResultSet select(java.lang.String userQuery)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs the general SELECT statement.
        Parameters:
        userQuery - the SQL SELECT query
        Returns:
        results, the ResultSet containing the selected rows of the table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - is thrown if the query fails.
        Pre:
        userQuery.length > 0

      • selectAll

        public static java.sql.ResultSet selectAll(java.lang.String tableName)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Runs a SELECT * FROM query to return every row of a specified table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - table to run the SELECT * from
        Returns:
        ResultSet, the set of results for this query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query fails.
        Pre:
        userQuery.length > 0
